column1: # webanno.custom.Participants | Participants | Participant # webanno.custom.Events | Events # webanno.custom.Corefchains | Coref | AttachTo=webanno.custom.Participants
#id=1
#text=I like baking cakes with my granddaughter .
#id=2
#text=I let her help pour in the ingredients and mix them together .
#id=3
#text=I take a box of cake mix to her house so we can bake a cake together .
#id=4
#text=We read the directions on the back of the box of cake mix .
#id=5
#text=Then we get out everything needed to make the cake .
#id=6
#text=We usually need eggs , cooking oil , and water or milk .
#id=7
#text=We also need a cake pan , a large mixing bowl , a measuring cup , and a mixing spoon .
#id=8
#text=Also it helps to make sure we have pot holders and a spatula .
#id=9
#text=I pre-heat the oven to the temperature given in the directions .
#text=Then I grease or oil the cake pan so the cake does not stick to the pan .
#text=Usually the directions want me to add a little flour to the pan to coat the oil , but I like to use sugar instead because it does not leave the outside of the cake looking like flour .
#text=We start by carefully cracking the egg shell and pouring the egg into a small cup or bowl to make sure we do not have a bad egg .
#text=Then we pour it into the mixing bowl .
#text=If we need more than one egg , we do each one separately the same way .
#text=Then we measure out the amount of oil needed and pour it into the mixing bowl , too .
#text=Then my granddaughter mixes up the eggs and oil really well .
#text=Next , I measure out the amount of liquid -LRB- water or milk -RRB- called for in the directions .
#text=She adds the liquid to the egg and oil mixture and stirs it all up really well .
#text=Then we add the cake mix , a little at a time , stirring well to mix .
#text=Then I pour the cake batter into the baking pan and spread it evenly with a spatula .
#text=Next , I carefully put the cake pan into the oven and set a timer to check it to see if it is done .
#text=We check to see if it is done by putting a clean toothpick into the center of the cake .
#text=If it comes out with little or none of the cake batter stuck to the toothpick , it is done and ready to take out of the oven , using pot holders .
#text=If there is still gooey stuff on the toothpick , the cake needs to be baked a little longer and then tested again .
#text=We are eager to see how our cake turns out .
#text=We play games while we wait for it to cool .
#text=Then we taste a little piece before we put frosting on the rest of the cake .
